abstract: For many marketers, newspaper Web sites are valuable for special occasions but cheaper generic placement is better for everyday use.
snippet: For many marketers, newspaper Web sites are valuable for special occasions but cheaper generic placement is better for everyday use.
lead_paragraph: It was a good day for newspaper Web sites when Mercedes-Benz USA introduced its updated E-Class cars this summer. Mercedes bought out the ad space on the home pages of The Washington Post, The Wall Street Journal and The New York Times, and had those sites create special 3-D ads for them, at an estimated cost of $100,000 a site.

abstract: Microsoft is perplexed that Google is giving away its Android smartphone software. Perhaps Google wants less to profit than to hurt Microsoft.
snippet: Microsoft is perplexed that Google is giving away its Android smartphone software. Perhaps Google wants less to profit than to hurt Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: Excuse me for repeating a hoary old joke:

abstract: HTC steps up branding efforts with a new global marketing campaign that emphasizes personalization, not unlike Yahoo’s current “It’s You” campaign.
snippet: HTC steps up branding efforts with a new global marketing campaign that emphasizes personalization, not unlike Yahoo’s current “It’s You” campaign.
lead_paragraph: Just over a year ago, HTC, until then a relatively obscure Taiwanese maker of tech gadgets, delivered the first smartphone powered by Google‘s Android software. Its collaboration with Google was something of a coming-out party for HTC. With it, the company, which had spent much of its life as a contract manufacturer for the likes of Compaq and Palm, was intensifying efforts to promote its own name in hopes of becoming a globally -recognized brand.

headline.main: HTC Says Its Phones Are All About ‘You’
